intro: Stillingia paucidentata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stillingia, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in late summer. Stillingia paucidentata is often found in moist, wooded areas and is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
